title: Bid Writing & Bid Management | Win More Tenders | BIM Takeoff
section: Why Most Tenders Lose Before Evaluation
text:
Why Most Tenders Lose Before Evaluation


Common Bid Failures
Contractors lose winnable tenders through avoidable mistakes:


 Non-compliant submissions (auto-rejected)


 Generic responses copied from previous bids


 Pricing errors and omissions


 Weak technical narratives


 Last-minute rush compromises quality


 No competitive positioning or differentiation



The Cost of Poor Bids

â€œ40-60% of tenders are eliminated at compliance stage before evaluation even begins. Among those that qualify, weak technical narratives score 30-40% lower than professional submissions, often losing despite competitive pricing.â€




Our Professional Bid Solution
Strategic, compliant submissions that win:


 100% compliance - pass all mandatory checks


 Bespoke responses - tailored to evaluation criteria


 Accurate pricing - verified quantities & rates


 Compelling narratives - demonstrate capability


 Early preparation - quality over rush


 Competitive strategy - position against rivals

title: Bid Writing & Bid Management | Win More Tenders | BIM Takeoff
text:
Our Proven 6-Step Bid Process


Step 1: Rapid Opportunity Assessment
Duration: 1-2 days
What We Do:

Review tender documents and requirements
Conduct Bid/No-Bid analysis
Assess competitive positioning
Evaluate resource availability
Estimate bid costs and expected margin
Provide Go/No-Go recommendation

What You Receive: Strategic recommendation with supporting analysis


Step 2: Bid Planning & Team Mobilization
Duration: 1-2 days
What We Do:

Develop bid plan and responsibility matrix
Establish submission timeline and milestones
Assign writers and technical specialists
Schedule clarification meetings with client
Initiate subcontractor engagement
Create document templates and structure

What You Receive: Comprehensive bid plan and team briefing


Step 3: Technical Solution Development
Duration: 5-10 days
What We Do:

Design methodology and construction sequence
Develop health & safety strategies
Create quality and environmental plans
Prepare construction programme (MS Project/P6)
Identify value engineering opportunities
Draft technical narratives for each evaluation criteria

What You Receive: Complete technical submission draft


Step 4: Commercial Pricing
Duration: 3-7 days (parallel with Step 3)
What We Do:

Prepare detailed Bill of Quantities
Obtain and evaluate subcontractor quotes
Verify material and labor rates
Calculate preliminaries and site overheads
Assess and price risks
Optimize margin and competitiveness

What You Receive: Detailed pricing schedule ready for review


Step 5: Bid Review & Refinement
Duration: 2-3 days
What We Do:

Red Team review (independent assessment)
Compliance check against all requirements
Evaluate against likely competitor approaches
Refine pricing and technical narrative
Strengthen weak areas identified in review
Final quality assurance by senior team

What You Receive: Enhanced bid ready for submission


Step 6: Submission & Presentation
Duration: 1-2 days
What We Do:

Format and finalize all documents
Submit electronically or physically (as required)
Obtain submission confirmation
Prepare presentation materials (if required)
Conduct mock interview and team briefing
Support during client interview/presentation

What You Receive: Submitted tender and presentation-ready team



Total Duration: 12-25 working days depending on tender complexity and return period

title: Bid Writing & Bid Management | Win More Tenders | BIM Takeoff
text:
Frequently Asked Questions



Q: How much lead time do you need to support a tender?


A: Ideally 3-4 weeks for a comprehensive tender. However, we routinely handle urgent opportunities with 10-14 daysâ€™ notice. For extremely tight deadlines (7 days or less), we can provide targeted support on specific elements like pricing or compliance checking, though full-service support is challenging.




Q: Can you help us win competitive tenders where weâ€™re not the lowest price?


A: Absolutely! Most modern tenders use quality/price splits (e.g., 60/40 or 70/30). Our technical writing ensures you score maximum points on quality criteria. On a 60/40 tender, a contractor 5-8% above lowest price can still win by scoring 90%+ on quality vs competitorsâ€™ 60-70%. We focus on demonstrating value, not just lowest cost.




Q: Do we need to share our full cost buildup with you?


A: Not necessarily. For pricing services, yes, we need full transparency to verify accuracy. For technical writing only, we can work with your summary pricing and net rates without seeing margin breakdowns. We sign NDAs as standard and treat all client information with absolute confidentiality.




Q: Whatâ€™s your success rate on tenders youâ€™ve supported?


A: Our clients average 35-45% win rates on competitive tenders we support (vs industry average of 15-25%). For negotiated or two-stage tenders where weâ€™re engaged early, success rates exceed 70%. Success depends on multiple factors including price competitiveness, client relationships, and competitive field.




Q: Can you help with framework applications and long-term appointments?


A: Yes! Framework bids require different approaches - demonstrating consistent capability, capacity, and delivery track record rather than project-specific solutions. Weâ€™ve successfully supported applications to major frameworks including local authority construction frameworks, NHS frameworks, Scape, Procure Partnerships, and Crown Commercial Service agreements.




Q: Do you work with smaller contractors and SMEs?


A: Absolutely. Many small/medium contractors lack in-house bid teams but need professional submissions to compete. We scale our services to match your needs and budget. For SMEs bidding Â£500K-2M projects, we typically provide pricing support and technical writing. Weâ€™re experienced at making smaller firms appear as professional as major contractors.




Q: What happens if we win? Do you provide post-contract support?


A: Yes! Many clients engage us for post-contract services including detailed cost planning, value engineering implementation, change order pricing, progress payment applications, and final account negotiations. We can also provide ongoing BIM coordination and quantity surveying support throughout project delivery.




Q: Can you help identify suitable tender opportunities?


A: Yes. We offer tender-watching services where we monitor contract notice platforms (Find a Tender, Contracts Finder, sector-specific portals) for opportunities matching your capabilities. We provide weekly summaries with bid/no-bid recommendations, saving your team hours of searching and allowing focus on high-probability opportunities.




Q: How much do bid writing services cost?


A: Fees depend on tender complexity, value, and services required. As a guide: Bid/No-Bid analysis Â£500-1,500; Pricing/BOQ Â£2,000-8,000; Technical writing Â£3,000-10,000; Full tender management Â£8,000-25,000. Framework applications Â£10,000-30,000. We provide fixed-price quotes within 24 hours of reviewing tender documents.

title: Construction Data Management | ISO 19650 | BIM Takeoff
section: Why Data Management Matters More Than Ever
text:
Why Data Management Matters More Than Ever


The Cost of Information Failure
Poor data management creates expensive problems:


 5-15% project time wasted finding information


 Rework from using wrong document versions


 Compliance failures (Building Safety Act, Golden Thread)


 Incomplete handover information


 O&M manuals missing critical data


 Legal exposure from poor records



Regulatory Imperative

â€œThe Building Safety Act 2022 and Golden Thread requirements make structured information management a legal necessity for high-risk buildings. Poor data management is no longer just inefficient - itâ€™s illegal.â€




Our Information Management Solution
ISO 19650 compliant, lifecycle-focused data management:


 ISO 19650 compliance - UK BIM Framework adherence


 Structured CDE - Everyone finds information instantly


 Version control - No more wrong-drawing mistakes


 Golden Thread ready - Building Safety Act compliance


 Digital handover - Complete, structured O&M data


 Audit trail - Full lifecycle documentation

title: Construction Data Management | ISO 19650 | BIM Takeoff
text:
Frequently Asked Questions



Q: Do we really need ISO 19650 compliance for our project?


A: For UK public sector projects, yes - itâ€™s mandatory. For private projects, itâ€™s highly recommended and increasingly expected by clients. Benefits include: reduced information risk, better handover quality, legal protection, and improved project outcomes. For high-risk buildings (HRBs), compliance is legally required under the Building Safety Act 2022.




Q: Whatâ€™s the difference between a CDE and just using SharePoint or Dropbox?


A: A proper CDE includes: structured workflows (WIP â†’ Shared â†’ Published â†’ Archived), version control, audit trails, permissions management, collaboration tools, and integration with project software. SharePoint can be configured as a CDE but requires significant customization. Generic file sharing (Dropbox, Google Drive) lacks the controls needed for compliant information management.




Q: When should we start information management on a project?


A: Ideally at tender stage or project inception. Early engagement allows us to shape the EIR, establish proper foundations, and train teams before problems arise. Mid-project rescue is possible but more challenging and expensive. Golden rule: start information management before design teams start producing information.




Q: Can you help with Building Safety Act compliance and Golden Thread?


A: Yes! We specialize in Golden Thread implementation for high-risk buildings (HRBs). This includes: safety case documentation, change control procedures, digital record-keeping, resident engagement information, and Building Safety Regulator submission support. Weâ€™ve worked on multiple Gateway 2 and Gateway 3 submissions.




Q: What if our design team already has a CDE? Do we still need your help?


A: We can still add value through: EIR development, information coordination across Task Teams, quality assurance, model federation, clash detection, handover preparation, and ensuring ISO 19650 compliance. Many projects have multiple CDEs (designer, contractor, client) requiring coordination - we manage these interfaces.




Q: How much does information management cost?


A: Depends on project size and service scope. Setup (EIR, BEP, CDE config) for a Â£10M project: Â£15K-25K. Part-time Information Manager support: Â£3K-5K/month. Full-time dedicated resource: Â£6K-10K/month. Golden Thread services: Â£20K-50K depending on building complexity. Investment typically saves 2-5x through reduced rework and better project outcomes.




Q: Can you take over information management mid-project if things arenâ€™t working?


A: Yes, we do project rescues regularly. Weâ€™ll assess current situation, identify gaps, implement remedial actions, establish proper processes, and bring project back to compliant state. Most mid-project issues stem from poor initial setup or inadequate resources. Timeline for rescue: 4-8 weeks depending on mess level.




Q: What happens to the data after project handover?


A: We prepare complete Asset Information Model (AIM) containing all as-built information, O&M manuals, warranties, and asset data. This transitions to the clientâ€™s facilities management system (CAFM) or is maintained in a dedicated operational CDE. We can provide ongoing support for FM data updates, ensuring the Golden Thread continues through building operations.




Q: Do you provide training for our internal team?


A: Yes! Training is essential for successful adoption. We provide: CDE user training (basic and advanced), Information Manager workshops, ISO 19650 awareness sessions, BEP development training, and custom sessions for specific roles (designers, contractors, FM teams). Training can be on-site or virtual, with materials and ongoing support included.

title: BREEAM & ESG Cost Modeling | Sustainable Construction Budgeting | BIM Takeoff
text:
Frequently Asked Questions



Q: Whatâ€™s the typical cost premium for BREEAM Excellent vs Good?


A: Based on our experience, BREEAM Excellent adds 3-5% to construction costs vs BREEAM Good, while Outstanding adds 6-8%. However, this varies significantly by building type, scale, and baseline specification. Our modeling provides project-specific figures with credit-by-credit breakdown, helping you target the most cost-effective rating level.




Q: How do you calculate embodied carbon costs?


A: We use comprehensive carbon databases (ICE, EPDs) to calculate kgCO2e per material/element. This is converted to cost using current and projected carbon pricing (Â£50-Â£150/tonne scenarios). We assess both upfront embodied carbon (materials, construction) and whole-life carbon (maintenance, replacement, end-of-life) to provide complete picture.




Q: Can you model ROI for net zero investments?


A: Yes, our 30-year life cycle cost models include: energy cost savings, carbon taxation avoidance, maintenance differentials, enhanced asset value, regulatory compliance costs, and grant/incentive capture. We provide NPV, IRR, and payback period analysis suitable for board-level decision making.




Q: Do you work with projects targeting multiple certifications?


A: Absolutely. Many projects pursue BREEAM + WELL, or LEED + Net Zero Carbon. We identify credit overlaps to minimize cost duplication, prioritize certifications based on market value, and optimize the overall sustainability strategy for maximum certification achievement at lowest cost.




Q: How do you handle uncertainty in future carbon pricing?


A: We model multiple scenarios (conservative Â£50/tonne, medium Â£100/tonne, aggressive Â£150/tonne) based on UK ETS trends and policy forecasts. This provides risk range rather than single-point estimate, allowing informed decision-making under uncertainty. We update scenarios as policy evolves.




Q: Can you cost biodiversity net gain requirements?


A: Yes, we cost on-site ecological enhancements, off-site habitat creation, biodiversity offsetting payments, ongoing management commitments, and monitoring requirements. We use Defra biodiversity metrics and habitat banking rates to provide accurate 30-year cost projections.




Q: What if we need to value engineer without losing certification?


A: Our value engineering approach prioritizes cost reductions that donâ€™t impact certification. We re-target credits (e.g., drop expensive credits, pursue cheaper ones), optimize system specifications, phase implementation, and leverage innovation credits. Our goal: achieve certification at lowest cost.




Q: How do you price ESG reporting compliance?


A: ESG reporting costs include: data collection systems, monitoring equipment, third-party verification, annual reporting preparation, and certification maintenance. We model these as operational costs (Â£5K-Â£50K annually depending on framework) and include in whole-life cost analysis.

title: Construction Logistics & Site Planning | 4D Simulation | BIM Takeoff
text:
Frequently Asked Questions



Q: When should we engage logistics planning on a project?


A: Ideally at RIBA Stage 3 (Spatial Coordination) or earlier for complex sites. This allows logistics constraints to inform design decisions. Absolute latest: 8-12 weeks before site mobilization. Urban projects with crane permits require earlier engagement (16-20 weeks before start) to allow for authority approvals.




Q: Can you help us win tenders by showing better logistics solutions than competitors?


A: Absolutely! High-quality logistics planning in tender submissions demonstrates competence and de-risks the project for clients. Weâ€™ve helped contractors win multiple projects by presenting superior site planning, phasing strategies, and 4D animations that competitors couldnâ€™t match. Typical investment: Â£8K-15K, often the margin between winning and losing Â£10M+ contracts.




Q: Do you handle temporary works design or just coordination?


A: We coordinate temporary works requirements and prepare schedules, but detailed structural design (scaffolding, falsework, propping) must be by certified Temporary Works Design companies. We work closely with TWC (Temporary Works Coordinator) and TWS (Temporary Works Supervisor) to ensure integrated planning. We can recommend specialist TW design firms if needed.




Q: Can you optimize our existing site layout to improve efficiency?


A: Yes! Mid-project optimization is common. We analyze current layouts, identify bottlenecks and inefficiencies, and propose improvements. Typical savings: 10-20% improvement in productivity through better material placement, optimized routes, and reduced double-handling. Most beneficial when implemented during natural break points (e.g., topping out, phase transitions).




Q: What if we donâ€™t have a BIM model yet?


A: We can work from 2D drawings to create 3D site models for logistics planning. For early-stage projects, even sketch designs are sufficient for concept logistics. The earlier weâ€™re engaged, the more value we add - but we can deliver useful planning at any stage, even with limited design information.




Q: How accurate are your crane coverage analyses?


A: Very accurate when based on manufacturer specifications. We use actual crane data from Liebherr, Potain, Wolff, etc. Analysis includes wind speed deratings, load charts, and boom configurations. We identify 100% of coverage gaps and over-sailing conflicts in 3D before crane selection. Typical outcome: optimal crane positioning saving Â£50K-200K vs â€œguessedâ€ placement.




Q: Can you create 4D animations for client presentations?


A: Yes! 4D animations are excellent stakeholder communication tools. We create professional animations showing construction sequences, phasing, and logistics operations over time. These are invaluable for: client confidence, planning approvals, neighbor engagement, and internal team coordination. Typical cost: Â£5K-15K for 2-5 minute professional animation depending on complexity.




Q: Do you provide on-site support during construction?


A: Yes, we offer weekly or monthly site visits for logistics coordination support. Services include: reviewing actual vs planned layouts, updating plans for design changes, optimizing phasing based on progress, coordinating major lifts and deliveries, and attending planning meetings. Typical cost: Â£1,500-3,000 per visit or monthly retainer Â£4K-8K.




Q: Whatâ€™s the typical ROI on logistics planning?


A: Clients typically save 5-15x the planning cost through: avoided crane hire errors (Â£50K-200K), optimized programme (2-6 weeks saved = Â£60K-180K prelims), reduced rework and material damage (Â£20K-100K), and prevented regulatory delays (invaluable). On a Â£20M project, Â£25K logistics planning investment typically returns Â£200K-500K in savings and risk mitigation.

title: Fast-Track Cost Control | Real-Time Construction Monitoring | BIM Takeoff
text:
Frequently Asked Questions



Q: How quickly can you get our project set up?


A: Setup takes 3-5 days. We need your baseline budget, cost coding structure, and access to contract documents. If you have a 5D BIM model, we can import that directly. Without BIM, setup may take 5-7 days. Our fastest deployment was 48 hours for an urgent project.




Q: What information do you need from us each week?


A: We need progress data (quantities installed), actual costs (invoices/timesheets), and any change orders or variations. Most clients provide this via a simple Excel template we supply. Data submission typically takes your team 2-3 hours per week. We can also integrate directly with your project management software.




Q: Can you work with projects already in progress?


A: Absolutely! We specialize in taking over cost control mid-project. Weâ€™ll reconcile all historical data, verify the baseline, and have you up and running within one week. This is particularly valuable when existing cost control has fallen behind or when changing project circumstances require more rigorous oversight.




Q: How do you handle contractor payment applications?


A: We review and verify contractor payment applications against actual progress. Our service includes cross-checking claimed quantities, verifying rates, ensuring proper valuations, and providing certified recommendations for payment. This protects you from overpayment and ensures you only pay for work properly executed.




Q: What happens if we identify a potential cost overrun?


A: We immediately flag the issue in our report with Red status, quantify the potential impact, identify the root cause, and provide recommended mitigation strategies. This might include value engineering alternatives, scope adjustments, phased approaches, or enhanced procurement strategies. Our goal is to provide actionable solutions, not just report problems.




Q: Do you integrate with our existing cost management software?


A: Yes, we can integrate with most major platforms including Procore, BIM 360, Oracle Primavera, MS Project, and various accounting systems. We export data in formats compatible with your systems. If direct API integration is needed, we can arrange that for Premium tier clients.




Q: What size projects do you typically work with?


A: We handle projects from Â£2M to Â£200M+. Smaller projects typically use our Essential tier with bi-weekly reporting. Mid-sized projects (Â£5M-Â£50M) work best with Professional tier weekly reporting. Large complex projects benefit from our Premium tier with dedicated management and real-time tracking.




Q: Can you help with value engineering during construction?


A: Yes! Our ongoing cost monitoring identifies opportunities for value engineering as the project progresses. We can quickly analyze alternative materials, methods, or sequencing that could reduce costs without compromising quality. This is included in Professional and Premium tiers.




Q: How do you charge for your services?


A: Pricing varies by service tier and project size. Essential tier starts from Â£2,500/month, Professional from Â£5,000/month, and Premium from Â£10,000/month. We also offer fixed-fee arrangements for the entire construction period with discounts for longer engagements (12+ months). Contact us for a custom quote based on your project specifics.

title: Automated Quantity Take-off | Multi-Level Validation | BIM Takeoff
section: Our Triple Validation System: Unmatched Accuracy
text:
Our Triple Validation System: Unmatched Accuracy

Why Three Validation Levels?
Construction projects cannot afford measurement errors. Our proprietary triple validation system ensures every quantity is verified through multiple independent processes, catching errors that single-validation systems miss.


Level 1: AI Extraction
Automated BIM Analysis
Our AI algorithms automatically extract quantities from your BIM model:

Pattern recognition for element identification
Automated measurement calculations
Clash detection and resolution
Duplicate element removal
Version control tracking

Accuracy: 98%
Duration: 1-2 hours


Level 2: Expert Review
Human Verification
Experienced Quantity Surveyors manually review AI outputs:

Cross-check against 2D drawings
Validate measurement methodologies
Identify missing elements
Apply construction knowledge
Verify unit conversions

Accuracy: 99.2%
Duration: 4-8 hours


Level 3: Cross-Reference
Independent Verification
Final validation against multiple sources:

Compare with historical project data
Benchmark against industry standards
Verify with specification documents
Check material relationships
Final QA sign-off

Final Accuracy: 99.5%+
Duration: 2-4 hours



Result: Each quantity is verified three times by independent systems, ensuring you receive the most accurate Bill of Quantities in the industry.

text:
Frequently Asked Questions



Q: What if my project doesnâ€™t have a BIM model?


A: We can work with 2D drawings (DWG, PDF) but timelines will be significantly longer as weâ€™ll need to extract quantities manually. For best results and fastest turnaround, we recommend using BIM models or consider our BIM modeling services to convert your 2D drawings first.




Q: How accurate is your triple validation system?


A: Our triple validation system achieves 99.5%+ accuracy when the source BIM model is complete and accurate. Each quantity is independently verified three times (AI extraction, expert review, cross-reference), ensuring the highest level of precision in the industry. We provide complete audit trails for all measurements.




Q: What happens if the design changes during the project?


A: Thatâ€™s the beauty of BIM-based take-offs! We can quickly update quantities based on the revised model - typically within 4-8 hours rather than weeks for manual re-measurement. We offer ongoing update services at discounted rates for active projects.




Q: Do you comply with international measurement standards?


A: Yes, we comply with RICS New Rules of Measurement (NRM), ISO 19650 BIM standards, and can adapt to local standards including Polish KNR, Australian AIQS, or any other regional requirements. Our Quantity Surveyors are experienced with international projects.




Q: Can you handle large, complex projects?


A: Absolutely. Weâ€™ve successfully completed take-offs for projects ranging from small renovations to 100,000+ sqm developments. Our AI-powered system actually performs better on larger projects where manual take-offs would be prohibitively time-consuming. Complex projects may require 3-4 days instead of 2-3.




Q: What level of detail (LOD) do you need in the BIM model?


A: We can work with LOD 300 and above for most projects. LOD 350-400 is ideal for detailed trade-specific take-offs. If your model is at LOD 200, we can still extract useful quantities but may need to supplement with 2D drawings for detailed measurements.




Q: Do you provide take-offs for specific trades or disciplines?


A: Yes! We can extract quantities for any trade: structural (concrete, steel, masonry), architectural (finishes, doors, windows), MEP (mechanical, electrical, plumbing, fire protection), civil works, and specialized systems. We tailor the BOQ format to match your trade requirements.




Q: How do you handle model inconsistencies or errors?


A: This is exactly why we use triple validation. Our Level 1 AI identifies clashes and duplicates automatically. Level 2 expert review catches model errors and cross-checks with 2D drawings. Level 3 verification ensures logical consistency. We document all assumptions and flag any areas of concern for your review.




Q: Whatâ€™s your pricing structure?


A: Each project is assessed individually based on project size, complexity, level of detail required, and specific deliverables. Contact us with your project details for an accurate quote within 24 hours.

title: Data Center Cost Estimation | Mission-Critical BIM 5D Services | BIM Takeoff
text:
Data Center Tier Complexity

Understanding Tier Classifications


Tier I - Basic Capacity
Uptime: 99.671% (28.8 hrs/yr downtime)
Redundancy: N
Timeline: 5-6 days
Typical Cost: Â£4,000-6,000/sqm
Characteristics: - Single power & cooling path - Non-redundant components - Planned maintenance requires shutdown - Basic infrastructure - Suitable for small offices/edge sites


Tier II - Redundant Components
Uptime: 99.741% (22.0 hrs/yr downtime)
Redundancy: N+1 components
Timeline: 6-7 days
Typical Cost: Â£5,000-8,000/sqm
Characteristics: - Single power & cooling path - Redundant components (N+1) - Some maintenance without shutdown - Improved infrastructure - Suitable for SME operations


Tier III - Concurrently Maintainable
Uptime: 99.982% (1.6 hrs/yr downtime)

title: Data Center Cost Estimation | Mission-Critical BIM 5D Services | BIM Takeoff
text:
Frequently Asked Questions



Q: What makes data center estimation different from other building types?


A: Data centers are 60-70% MEP systems (vs 20-30% for typical buildings), with complex redundancy requirements, mission-critical reliability standards, and power densities 10-50x higher than office buildings. Traditional estimation methods often miss critical MEP interdependencies and redundancy specifications.




Q: Can you estimate data centers at different tier levels?


A: Yes, we have extensive experience with all tier classifications (I through IV). We verify compliance with tier standards and can model cost differences between tier levels to support decision-making. Tier III and IV projects typically require 9-10 days due to their complexity.




Q: How do you handle N+1 and 2N redundancy requirements?


A: We systematically verify redundancy configurations for all critical systems (power, cooling, network paths). Our 5D BIM workflow identifies each redundant component and ensures proper load distribution, maintenance bypass capability, and concurrent maintainability where required.




Q: What power density ranges can you accommodate?


A: We handle the full spectrum from standard density (5-10 kW per rack) through high density (10-20 kW) to hyperscale (20-30+ kW). Our analysis includes electrical infrastructure sizing, cooling capacity requirements, and future expansion provisions for each density scenario.




Q: Do you include IT equipment in your estimates?


A: We focus on the building infrastructure and MEP systems. IT equipment (servers, storage, networking gear) is typically excluded but we can include allowances based on client specifications. We always clarify the scope boundary at project inception.




Q: How quickly can you assess the cost impact of design changes?


A: Because we work with 5D BIM, most design changes can be re-costed within 4-8 hours. This includes changes to power density, cooling strategy, redundancy level, or tier classification. Complex changes affecting multiple systems may require 1-2 days.




Q: Can you help with PUE (Power Usage Effectiveness) calculations?


A: Yes, we can model expected PUE based on the proposed cooling strategy, climate zone, and equipment efficiency. We can also compare alternative cooling approaches (air-cooled vs water-cooled, free cooling, etc.) and their cost/efficiency tradeoffs.




Q: Whatâ€™s your fee structure for data center projects?


A: Fees vary based on tier level, size, and complexity. As a guide: - Tier I/II (500-2,000 sqm): Â£8,000-15,000 - Tier III (2,000-5,000 sqm): Â£15,000-30,000 - Tier III (5,000-10,000+ sqm): Â£30,000-50,000 - Tier IV (any size): Premium pricing due to complexity
Express service carries a 30% premium. Contact us for a specific quote.




Q: Do you support edge computing facilities and modular data centers?


A: Yes, we work with edge facilities, containerized solutions, and modular data centers. Our approach scales from single-rack edge nodes to multi-MW modular deployments. We understand the unique cost dynamics of prefabricated and rapidly deployed solutions.

title: Building Remediation Cost Estimation | Cladding & Fire Safety | BIM Takeoff
text:
Building Safety Regulator (BSR) Expertise


Navigating the New Building Safety Regime
The Building Safety Act 2022 introduced the Building Safety Regulator (BSR) under the Health and Safety Executive (HSE), fundamentally changing how Higher Risk Buildings (HRB) are designed, constructed, and maintained. We provide specialized cost estimation services aligned with BSR requirements.


Higher Risk Buildings (HRB) Definition
Buildings Requiring BSR Registration: - 18 metres or more in height, OR - 7 storeys or more, AND - Contains at least 2 residential units
Our Cost Support: - Registration compliance costs - Mandatory occurrence reporting systems - Resident engagement requirements - Safety case preparation budgets


Gateway Process Costing
Gateway 2 (Planning Stage): - Fire statement preparation - Building Safety Act compliance review - BSR submission documentation
Gateway 3 (Pre-Construction): - Detailed design compliance - Fire and structural strategies - Change control procedures - Principal Designer costs


Building Safety Case Support
Safety Case Development Costs: - Risk assessments & evaluations - Building management structure - Safety management systems - Documentation & compliance records - Ongoing monitoring requirements - Mandatory occurrence reporting




BSR Submission Cost Estimation

We provide detailed cost breakdowns for BSR-related activities:


Registration & Compliance (Typical Costs): - BSR registration application: Â£2,000-4,000 - Building Safety Case preparation: Â£15,000-35,000 - Resident engagement strategy: Â£5,000-12,000 - Mandatory occurrence reporting system: Â£3,000-8,000 - Annual compliance review: Â£8,000-15,000


Professional Team Requirements: - Principal Designer appointment - Principal Contractor obligations - Building Safety Manager (in occupation) - Accountable Person duties - Competence framework compliance - Change control management




Key BSR Cost Drivers We Quantify:



 Enhanced documentation requirements


 Digital information management (ISO 19650)


 Competence verification systems


 Gateway submission preparations


 Golden thread information requirements


 Resident engagement obligations






Remediation-Specific BSR Requirements
For existing HRBs requiring remediation, BSR compliance adds specific cost implications:


Enhanced Surveys & Assessments - Type 4 Fire Risk Assessment - Intrusive building investigations - Structural integrity reviews - External wall system (EWS1) assessments - Golden thread data creation


Compliance Documentation - Safety case updates during works - Change control procedures - Contractor competence verification - Mandatory occurrence reporting - Resident notification protocols


Post-Remediation Requirements - Updated building safety information - Revised safety case submission - As-built BIM models (ISO 19650) - Resident information updates - BSR notification of completion




 Important BSR Deadline Context


All existing HRBs must be registered with BSR. Accountable Persons face significant penalties for non-compliance. Our cost estimates help building owners budget for mandatory compliance upgrades alongside remediation works.

title: Building Remediation Cost Estimation | Cladding & Fire Safety | BIM Takeoff
text:
Frequently Asked Questions



Q: Can you estimate remediation costs without intrusive surveys?


A: We can provide indicative budgets based on visual surveys and typical defect patterns, but we strongly recommend intrusive investigation before finalizing estimates. We typically include 20-25% contingency for non-intrusive estimates vs 10-15% for fully surveyed buildings.




Q: How do you handle unknown defects discovered during works?


A: Our estimates include risk-based contingencies (typically 15-25%) calculated from intrusive survey findings and industry benchmarks. We also provide a risk register identifying potential additional costs with probability assessments.




Q: Can you support Building Safety Fund (BSF) applications?


A: Yes, we regularly prepare cost documentation for BSF and other grant applications. We provide the detailed breakdown formats required by funding bodies and can support the technical review process.




Q: What about phasing to keep residents in occupation?


A: We specialize in occupied building remediation. Our estimates include phasing strategies, protection costs, temporary works, resident liaison, and the cost premium for working around occupants (typically 15-20% additional).




Q: How accurate are remediation estimates given the unknowns?


A: With proper intrusive surveys, we achieve Â±5-8% accuracy on remediation projects (vs our standard Â±5% for new build). The additional variance accounts for unexpected defects. We provide clear contingency breakdowns for transparency.




Q: Can you estimate alternative cladding systems for comparison?


A: Absolutely. We regularly compare different compliant cladding systems (brick slip, render, metal panels, terracotta) with full cost implications including performance characteristics, maintenance, and longevity considerations.




Q: What about asbestos or other hazardous materials?


A: We include allowances for asbestos surveys and removal when building age suggests likely presence. We work with specialist asbestos surveyors to refine removal costs and include proper disposal, air monitoring, and notification costs.




Q: Whatâ€™s your fee structure for remediation projects?


A: Fees vary based on building size, defect complexity, and urgency. As a rough guide: - Small building (20-50 units): Â£3,500-6,000 - Medium building (50-100 units): Â£6,000-10,000 - Large building (100-200 units): Â£10,000-16,000 - Complex multi-block: Â£16,000-30,000
Express service (3-4 days) carries a 25% premium. Contact us for a specific quote.

Output: Project plan and timeline confirmation


Automated Quantity Extraction
Days 1-4
What We Do: - Extract all structural elements - Quantify faÃ§ade and glazing - Measure internal fit-out areas - Calculate MEP requirements - Count sanitary fixtures, lifts, etc.
Technology: - BIM 5D extraction tools - Floor area analysis - Cross-checking with specifications
Output: Complete quantity take-off (BOQ)


Cost Application & Analysis
Days 4-7
What We Do: - Apply current market rates - Factor in location adjustments - Calculate MEP systems costs - Include fit-out specifications - Add preliminaries (10-12%) - Apply contingency (5-8%) - Run alternative scenarios if requested
Database Sources: - BCIS (UK) / Rawlinsons (Australia) - Live specialist quotes - Recent commercial benchmarks
Output: Detailed cost estimate with breakdown


Quality Review & Reporting
Days 7-9
What We Do: - Technical peer review - Check against market benchmarks - Verify yield implications - Prepare visual cost breakdown - Create executive summary - Schedule presentation/meeting
Deliverables: - Executive summary (2-3 pages) - Cost breakdown by element - Shell vs fit-out separation - BOQ with quantities and rates - Cost per sqm analysis - Alternative scenarios (if requested)
Format: PDF + Excel workbooks


Presentation & Handover
Day 9-10
What We Do: - Present findings to development team - Explain key cost drivers - Review value engineering options - Discuss yield optimization - Answer questions - Provide ongoing support
Meeting Options: - In-person (UK only) - Video conference (all locations) - Investment committee presentations
Support: 30 days post-delivery included



Typical Total Duration: 7-10 working days from BIM model receipt to final report
Express Service: Available for urgent projects (4-5 days) at 25% premium

title: Commercial Development Cost Estimation | Office & Retail | BIM Takeoff
text:
Frequently Asked Questions



Q: Whatâ€™s the largest commercial project youâ€™ve estimated?


A: Weâ€™ve worked on office buildings up to 50,000 sqm and mixed-use developments exceeding 100,000 sqm total area. Our 5D BIM workflow scales effectively for major commercial projects including multi-tower developments.




Q: Can you separate shell & core from CAT A fit-out costs?


A: Absolutely. We routinely provide cost breakdowns showing base build (shell & core), landlord fit-out (CAT A), and tenant fit-out (CAT B) separately. This is essential for investment analysis and lease negotiations.




Q: How quickly can you provide a feasibility estimate for investment decisions?


A: For early-stage feasibility estimates based on concept designs, we can provide cost ranges within 2-3 days using benchmarks and parametric estimating. This gives investors the confidence to proceed to detailed design.




Q: What if the tenant wants different specifications after your estimate?


A: Because we work with 5D BIM, we can quickly recalculate costs for specification changes within hours to a day. This is particularly valuable during pre-let negotiations when tenants request variations.




Q: Do you include BREEAM/WELL certification costs?


A: Yes, we include both the construction cost premium for achieving target ratings (e.g., BREEAM Excellent) and the professional fees for assessment and certification. We can model different rating scenarios to help optimize investment returns.




Q: Can you provide cost breakdowns by floor or phase?


A: Yes, we regularly prepare cost breakdowns by floor, wing, or construction phase. This is particularly useful for phased developments or buildings with varying specifications across different floors.




Q: How do you handle complex MEP systems like VRV/VRF?


A: We have extensive experience costing advanced MEP systems including VRV/VRF air conditioning, displacement ventilation, and sophisticated BMS controls. Our estimates reflect the complexity of modern Grade A office specifications.




Q: Whatâ€™s your fee structure for commercial projects?


A: Fees vary based on project size, complexity, and timeline. As a rough guide: - Small office (1,000-5,000 sqm): Â£3,000-6,000 - Medium office (5,000-15,000 sqm): Â£6,000-12,000 - Large office (15,000-30,000 sqm): Â£12,000-20,000 - Major/mixed-use (30,000+ sqm): Â£20,000-40,000
Express service (4-5 days) carries a 25% premium. Contact us for a specific quote.

text:
NajczÄ™Å›ciej Zadawane Pytania



P: Kiedy powinniÅ›my zleciÄ‡ planowanie logistyki w projekcie?


O: Idealnie na etapie RIBA 3 (Koordynacja Przestrzenna) lub wczeÅ›niej dla zÅ‚oÅ¼onych placÃ³w. Pozwala to, aby ograniczenia logistyczne wpÅ‚ywaÅ‚y na decyzje projektowe. NajpÃ³Åºniej: 8-12 tygodni przed mobilizacjÄ… na placu. Projekty miejskie z pozwoleniami na Å¼urawie wymagajÄ… wczeÅ›niejszego zaangaÅ¼owania (16-20 tygodni przed startem) dla zatwierdzeÅ„ administracyjnych.




P: Czy moÅ¼ecie pomÃ³c nam wygraÄ‡ przetargi poprzez lepsze rozwiÄ…zania logistyczne niÅ¼ konkurencja?


O: Absolutnie! Wysokiej jakoÅ›ci planowanie logistyki w ofertach przetargowych Ğ´ĞµĞ¼Ğ¾Ğ½ÑÑ‚Ñ€Ñƒuje ĞºĞ¾Ğ¼Ğ¿ĞµÑ‚encjÄ™ i zmniejsza ryzyko projektu dla klientÃ³w. PomogliÅ›my wykonawcom wygraÄ‡ wiele projektÃ³w prezentujÄ…c lepsze planowanie placu, strategie fazowania i animacje 4D, ktÃ³rych konkurencja nie mogÅ‚a dorÃ³wnaÄ‡. Typowa inwestycja: 32-60 tys. PLN, czÄ™sto marÅ¼a miÄ™dzy wygranÄ… a przegranÄ… kontraktÃ³w o wartoÅ›ci 40M+ PLN.




P: Czy zajmujecie siÄ™ projektowaniem zabezpieczeÅ„ tymczasowych czy tylko koordynacjÄ…?


O: Koordynujemy wymagania zabezpieczeÅ„ tymczasowych i przygotowujemy harmonogramy, ale szczegÃ³Å‚owe projektowanie konstrukcyjne (rusztowania, deskowanie, podpÃ³rki) musi byÄ‡ wykonane przez certyfikowane firmy projektowe. Pracujemy blisko z TWC (Koordynator ZabezpieczeÅ„ Tymczasowych) i TWS (Nadzorca ZabezpieczeÅ„ Tymczasowych) dla zapewnienia zintegrowanego planowania. W razie potrzeby moÅ¼emy poleciÄ‡ specjalistyczne firmy projektowe.




P: Czy moÅ¼ecie zoptymalizowaÄ‡ nasz istniejÄ…cy ukÅ‚ad placu dla poprawy wydajnoÅ›ci?


O: Tak! Optymalizacja w trakcie projektu jest powszechna. Analizujemy obecne ukÅ‚ady, identyfikujemy wÄ…skie gardÅ‚a i nieefektywnoÅ›ci, oraz proponujemy ulepszenia. Typowe oszczÄ™dnoÅ›ci: 10-20% poprawy wydajnoÅ›ci poprzez lepsze rozmieszczenie materiaÅ‚Ã³w, zoptymalizowane trasy i zmniejszone podwÃ³jne przeÅ‚adunki. Najbardziej korzystne przy wdroÅ¼eniu w naturalnych punktach przerwowych (np. wykoÅ„czenie struktury, przejÅ›cia faz).




P: Co jeÅ›li nie mamy jeszcze modelu BIM?


O: MoÅ¼emy pracowaÄ‡ z rysunkÃ³w 2D tworzÄ…c modele 3D placu do planowania logistyki. Dla projektÃ³w we wczesnej fazie, nawet szkice projektowe wystarczajÄ… do koncepcyjnej logistyki. Im wczeÅ›niej jesteÅ›my zaangaÅ¼owani, tym wiÄ™kszÄ… wartoÅ›Ä‡ dodajemy - ale moÅ¼emy dostarczyÄ‡ uÅ¼yteczne planowanie na kaÅ¼dym etapie, nawet z ograniczonymi informacjami projektowymi.




P: Jak dokÅ‚adne sÄ… wasze analizy zasiÄ™gu Å¼urawia?


O: Bardzo dokÅ‚adne przy bazowaniu na specyfikacjach producenta. UÅ¼ywamy rzeczywistych danych Å¼urawi od Liebherr, Potain, Wolff, itp. Analiza obejmuje obniÅ¼enie charakterystyk dla prÄ™dkoÅ›ci wiatru, wykresy obciÄ…Å¼eÅ„ i konfiguracje wysiÄ™gnikÃ³w. Identyfikujemy 100% luk zasiÄ™gu i konfliktÃ³w przestrzeni powietrznej w 3D przed wyborem Å¼urawia. Typowy rezultat: optymalne pozycjonowanie Å¼urawia oszczÄ™dzajÄ…ce 200-800 tys. PLN vs â€œzgadniÄ™teâ€ umieszczenie.




P: Czy moÅ¼ecie tworzyÄ‡ animacje 4D do prezentacji dla klientÃ³w?


O: Tak! Animacje 4D sÄ… doskonaÅ‚ymi narzÄ™dziami komunikacji z interesariuszami. Tworzymy profesjonalne animacje pokazujÄ…ce sekwencje budowy, fazowanie i operacje logistyczne w czasie. SÄ… nieocenione dla: zaufania klienta, zatwierdzeÅ„ planistycznych, zaangaÅ¼owania sÄ…siadÃ³w i wewnÄ™trznej koordynacji zespoÅ‚u. Typowy koszt: 20-60 tys. PLN za 2-5 minutowÄ… profesjonalnÄ… animacjÄ™ w zaleÅ¼noÅ›ci od zÅ‚oÅ¼onoÅ›ci.




P: Czy zapewniacie wsparcie na placu podczas budowy?


O: Tak, oferujemy tygodniowe lub miesiÄ™czne wizyty na placu dla wsparcia koordynacji logistyki. UsÅ‚ugi obejmujÄ…: przeglÄ…d rzeczywistych vs planowanych ukÅ‚adÃ³w, aktualizacjÄ™ planÃ³w dla zmian projektowych, optymalizacjÄ™ fazowania wedÅ‚ug postÄ™pu, koordynacjÄ™ gÅ‚Ã³wnych podniesieÅ„ i dostaw, oraz uczestnictwo w spotkaniach planistycznych. Typowy koszt: 6-12 tys. PLN za wizytÄ™ lub abonament miesiÄ™czny 16-32 tys. PLN.




P: Jaki jest typowy ROI planowania logistyki?


O: Klienci zazwyczaj oszczÄ™dzajÄ… 5-15x kosztu planowania poprzez: unikniÄ™te bÅ‚Ä™dy wynajmu Å¼urawia (200-800 tys. PLN), zoptymalizowany harmonogram (2-6 tygodni oszczÄ™dnoÅ›ci = 240-720 tys. PLN kosztÃ³w poÅ›rednich), zmniejszone przerÃ³bki i uszkodzenia materiaÅ‚Ã³w (80-400 tys. PLN), oraz zapobieÅ¼one opÃ³Åºnienia regulacyjne (bezcenne). W projekcie 80M PLN, inwestycja 100 tys. PLN w planowanie logistyki typowo zwraca 800 tys.-2M PLN w oszczÄ™dnoÅ›ciach i mitygacji ryzyka.

P: Kiedy w procesie projektowania powinniÅ›my przeprowadziÄ‡ analizÄ™ wieloscenariuszowÄ…?


O: Im wczeÅ›niej, tym lepiej! Idealnie podczas fazy koncepcyjnej (RIBA Stage 2), gdy projekt jest jeszcze elastyczny, a zmiany sÄ… tanie. MoÅ¼emy rÃ³wnieÅ¼ dostarczyÄ‡ wartoÅ›Ä‡ na etapie koordynacji przestrzennej (RIBA Stage 3), choÄ‡ opcje stajÄ… siÄ™ bardziej ograniczone. Po etapie 4 analiza jest zazwyczaj ograniczona do inÅ¼ynierii wartoÅ›ci specyficznych elementÃ³w.




P: Ile scenariuszy powinniÅ›my oceniÄ‡?

Dla zÅ‚oÅ¼onych projektÃ³w z wieloma zmiennymi moÅ¼emy oceniÄ‡ 10-12 scenariuszy. Dla prostych decyzji (np. wybÃ³r pojedynczego materiaÅ‚u) 3-4 scenariusze mogÄ… wystarczyÄ‡.

MoÅ¼emy rÃ³wnieÅ¼ pomÃ³c w szybkim modelowaniu koncepcyjnym, jeÅ›li to konieczne.




P: Jak dokÅ‚adne sÄ… porÃ³wnania kosztÃ³w?


O: Na etapie koncepcyjnym (RIBA 2) oczekuj dokÅ‚adnoÅ›ci Â±15-20% - wystarczajÄ…cej do porÃ³wnania scenariuszy. Na etapie koordynacji przestrzennej (RIBA 3) osiÄ…gamy Â±10-15%. Kluczowe jest to, Å¼e wszystkie scenariusze uÅ¼ywajÄ… spÃ³jnej metodologii, wiÄ™c porÃ³wnania wzglÄ™dne pozostajÄ… waÅ¼ne, nawet jeÅ›li koszty bezwzglÄ™dne majÄ… margines.




P: Czy moÅ¼ecie pomÃ³c nam osiÄ…gnÄ…Ä‡ konkretne cele oszczÄ™dnoÅ›ciowe?

JeÅ›li macie cel (np. â€œzmniejszenie kosztÃ³w inwestycyjnych o 15%â€), zaprojektujemy scenariusze specjalnie w celu osiÄ…gniÄ™cia tego celu, minimalizujÄ…c jednoczeÅ›nie wpÅ‚yw na wydajnoÅ›Ä‡. Zidentyfikujemy wiele Å›cieÅ¼ek do celu, pozwalajÄ…c wybraÄ‡ najlepszy kompromis miÄ™dzy kosztem, czasem i jakoÅ›ciÄ….




P: Czy uwzglÄ™dniacie zrÃ³wnowaÅ¼ony rozwÃ³j w swojej analizie?


O: Absolutnie. KaÅ¼dy scenariusz standardowo zawiera obliczenie wÄ™gla wbudowanego i ocenÄ™ energii operacyjnej. MoÅ¼emy rÃ³wnieÅ¼ uwzglÄ™dniÄ‡ szczegÃ³Å‚owÄ… analizÄ™ punktÃ³w BREEAM, potencjaÅ‚ gospodarki obiegu zamkniÄ™tego, pochodzenie materiaÅ‚Ã³w i modelowanie wÄ™gla w caÅ‚ym cyklu Å¼ycia, jeÅ›li zrÃ³wnowaÅ¼ony rozwÃ³j jest kluczowym priorytetem.




P: Co siÄ™ dzieje po wybraniu optymalnego scenariusza?


O: Dostarczamy szczegÃ³Å‚owÄ… mapÄ™ drogowÄ… wdroÅ¼enia, w tym notatki specyfikacyjne, strategie zakupowe i Å›rodki mitygacji ryzyka dla wybranego scenariusza. Wielu klientÃ³w nastÄ™pnie zleca nam szczegÃ³Å‚owe szacowanie kosztÃ³w, dopracowanie inÅ¼ynierii wartoÅ›ci lub bieÅ¼Ä…cÄ… kontrolÄ™ kosztÃ³w w miarÄ™ rozwoju projektu.

title: Housing Association Cost Estimation | Social Housing Projects | BIM Takeoff
text:
Frequently Asked Questions



Q: Can you help with grant funding applications?


A: Yes, we regularly prepare detailed cost documentation for grant funding applications including Social Housing Decarbonisation Fund, Affordable Homes Programme, and local authority grants. We provide the cost breakdowns and specifications required by funding bodies.




Q: How do you handle properties with different conditions and sizes?


A: We create property archetypes based on building type, size, and condition, then calculate costs for each archetype. This provides accurate per-unit costs while maintaining detailed breakdowns for the overall programme.




Q: Can you provide materials for resident consultation?


A: Yes, we prepare resident-friendly consultation materials including visual presentations, cost breakdown summaries, alternative option comparisons, and Q&A documentation suitable for member assemblies and individual consultations.




Q: What about estimating for occupied properties?


A: We specialize in occupied building works. Our estimates include phasing strategies, protection measures, decanting costs (where necessary), resident liaison time, and the cost premium for working around occupants (typically 10-15% additional).




Q: How accurate are estimates for Decent Homes compliance?


A: With proper stock condition surveys, we achieve Â±5-8% accuracy on Decent Homes refurbishment programmes. We include appropriate contingencies (5-10%) for properties where condition surveys reveal uncertainties.




Q: How do you approach value engineering for tight budgets?


A: We identify value engineering opportunities without compromising quality or compliance. This includes optimizing specifications, exploring alternative materials, value-analyzing phasing options, and maximizing volume discounts through strategic procurement.




Q: Whatâ€™s your fee structure for housing association projects?


A: Fees vary based on programme size and complexity. As a rough guide: - Small programme (50-100 units): Â£3,000-6,000 - Medium programme (100-300 units): Â£6,000-12,000 - Large programme (300-500 units): Â£12,000-20,000
Express service (4-5 days) carries a 25% premium. Contact us for a specific quote.

title: Residential Development Cost Estimation | Multi-Unit Housing | BIM Takeoff
text:
Frequently Asked Questions



Q: Whatâ€™s the largest residential project youâ€™ve estimated?


A: Weâ€™ve worked on developments ranging from 10-unit townhouse complexes to 200+ apartment towers, including mixed-use developments with retail and commercial elements. Our 5D BIM workflow scales effectively for any project size.




Q: Can you handle mixed-use developments with retail/commercial elements?


A: Absolutely. We regularly estimate mixed-use projects combining residential, retail, office, and parking elements. We provide separate cost breakdowns for each use category and handle the interface complexities between different uses.




Q: How quickly can you provide a feasibility estimate for planning applications?


A: For planning-stage feasibility estimates based on concept drawings, we can typically provide a cost range within 2-3 days. This uses benchmarks and parametric estimating appropriate for early-stage decision making.




Q: What if the developer wants to change the unit mix after your estimate?


A: Because we work with 5D BIM and unit type libraries, we can quickly recalculate costs for different unit mixes within hours. This includes adjusting the balance between 1-bed, 2-bed, and 3-bed apartments.




Q: Do you include affordable housing requirements in your estimates?


A: Yes, we can provide separate cost breakdowns for market-rate and affordable housing units, accounting for specification differences and any grant funding implications. We understand Section 106 requirements and help optimize the affordable housing mix.




Q: Can you provide cost breakdowns by construction phase?


A: Yes, we regularly prepare cost breakdowns by construction phase, building block, or release phase. This is particularly useful for staged developments where different blocks are built at different times or for phased funding requirements.




Q: How do you handle varying ground conditions across a site?


A: We rely on the clientâ€™s ground investigation reports to assess foundation requirements. For sites with varying conditions, we zone the development and apply appropriate foundation solutions (piled, raft, strip footings) based on the geotechnical recommendations for each zone.




Q: Whatâ€™s your fee structure for residential projects?


A: Fees vary based on project size, complexity, and timeline. As a rough guide: - Small development (10-30 units): Â£2,500-4,500 - Medium development (30-80 units): Â£4,500-8,000 - Large development (80-150 units): Â£8,000-14,000 - Major development (150+ units): Â£14,000-25,000
Express service (4-5 days) carries a 25% premium. Contact us for a specific quote.

title: Warehouse & Logistics Cost Estimation | BIM 5D Services | BIM Takeoff
text:
Our Warehouse Estimation Process


Initial Review & Setup
Day 1 (4-6 hours)
What We Do: - Review BIM model (IFC/Revit) or 2D drawings - Verify structural grid and bay sizes - Confirm clear height requirements - Identify tenant-specific requirements - Set up repetitive element libraries
Client Provides: - Architectural & structural drawings/models - Specification documents - Site information - Any tenant fit-out requirements
Output: Project plan and timeline confirmation


Automated Quantity Extraction
Days 1-2
What We Do: - Extract all structural elements automatically - Quantify cladding and roofing systems - Calculate foundation volumes - Count loading docks and doors - Measure floor areas and wall lengths
Technology: - BIM 5D extraction tools - Repetitive element automation - Cross-checking with 2D documents
Output: Complete quantity take-off (BOQ)


Cost Application & Analysis
Days 2-4
What We Do: - Apply current market rates - Factor in project location - Include logistics considerations - Calculate preliminaries (12-15%) - Add appropriate contingency (5-10%) - Run alternative scenarios if requested
Database Sources: - BCIS (UK) / Rawlinsons (Australia) - Live supplier quotes - Recent project benchmarks
Output: Detailed cost estimate with breakdown


Quality Review & Reporting
Days 4-5
What We Do: - Technical peer review - Check against benchmarks - Verify calculations - Prepare visual cost breakdown - Create executive summary - Schedule presentation/meeting
Deliverables: - Executive summary (2-3 pages) - Detailed cost breakdown by element - BOQ with quantities and rates - Cost per sqm analysis - Alternative scenarios (if requested)
Format: PDF + Excel workbooks


Presentation & Handover
Day 5-7
What We Do: - Present findings to project team - Explain key cost drivers - Review any value engineering options - Discuss any risks or assumptions - Answer questions - Provide ongoing support
Meeting Options: - In-person (UK only) - Video conference (all locations) - Written Q&A via email
Support: 30 days post-delivery included



Typical Total Duration: 5-7 working days from BIM model receipt to final report
Express Service: Available for urgent projects (3-4 days) at 25% premium

title: Warehouse & Logistics Cost Estimation | BIM 5D Services | BIM Takeoff
text:
Frequently Asked Questions



Q: Whatâ€™s the largest warehouse project youâ€™ve estimated?


A: Weâ€™ve worked on distribution centers up to 150,000 sqm single-tenant facilities and multi-unit parks totaling 300,000+ sqm. No project is too large for our 5D BIM workflow.




Q: Can you handle pre-engineered building systems (Butler, Kirby, etc.)?


A: Absolutely. We have extensive experience with all major pre-engineered building systems including Butler, Kirby, Astron, Rubb, and Frisomat. Our cost databases include standard configurations for these systems.




Q: How quickly can you provide a budget estimate for planning purposes?


A: For a planning-stage budget estimate based on concept drawings, we can typically provide a cost range within 1-2 days. This uses benchmarks and parametric estimating rather than detailed take-offs.




Q: What if the client changes the clear height requirement after your estimate?


A: Because we work with 5D BIM, we can quickly re-calculate the cost impact of height changes, typically within a few hours. This includes structural implications, cladding adjustments, and MEP modifications.




Q: Do you include automated material handling systems in your estimates?


A: We can include allowances for automated storage and retrieval systems (ASRS), conveyor systems, and sortation equipment. For complex automation, we typically work with specialist suppliers to get accurate budgets.




Q: Can you provide cost breakdowns by zone for phased construction?


A: Yes, we regularly prepare cost breakdowns by construction phase or tenant zone. This is particularly useful for speculative development where different units may be built or fitted out at different times.




Q: How do you handle site-specific conditions like poor ground?


A: We rely on the clientâ€™s ground investigation reports to assess foundation requirements. For poor ground conditions, we include appropriate foundation solutions (piling, ground improvement, etc.) based on the geotechnical recommendations.




Q: Whatâ€™s your fee structure for warehouse projects?


A: Fees vary based on project size, complexity, and timeline. As a rough guide: - Small warehouse (5,000-10,000 sqm): Â£3,000-5,000 - Medium warehouse (10,000-30,000 sqm): Â£5,000-8,000 - Large warehouse (30,000-50,000 sqm): Â£8,000-12,000 - Mega facility (50,000+ sqm): Â£12,000-20,000
Express service (3-4 days) carries a 25% premium. Contact us for a specific quote.

title: Comprehensive Reporting & Dashboards | Business Intelligence | BIM Takeoff
text:
Frequently Asked Questions



Q: Do we need to buy PowerBI or Tableau licenses?


A: Yes, youâ€™ll need licenses for your users. PowerBI Pro costs ~Â£8/user/month, PowerBI Premium ~Â£16/user/month. Tableau is ~Â£60/user/month. We can advise on the most cost-effective licensing model for your organization. Alternatively, we can build web-based dashboards using open-source tools.




Q: Can you connect to our existing project management software?


A: Yes! Weâ€™ve integrated with all major construction software including Procore, BIM 360, MS Project, Primavera P6, and various ERP systems. If your software has an API or can export data, we can connect it. Even Excel-based workflows can be automated.




Q: How long does implementation take?


A: Basic dashboards (2-3 reports) take 20-25 days. Complex implementations with multiple data sources and advanced analytics may take 35-45 days. We can deliver an MVP (minimum viable product) in 10 days for urgent projects, then enhance iteratively.




Q: What if our data is messy or inconsistent?


A: Data quality is often the biggest challenge! Our implementation process includes data cleansing, standardization, and validation rules. Weâ€™ll work with your team to establish data governance processes. In most cases, we can handle 80% of cleanup automatically, with the remaining 20% requiring process improvements.




Q: Can we customize the dashboards ourselves after implementation?


A: Absolutely! We provide full training and documentation so your power users can modify reports, add new visualizations, and adjust filters. We build dashboards with future customization in mind. Most clients become self-sufficient within 2-3 months, though weâ€™re available for complex changes or new dashboard development.




Q: What happens if data sources change or we add new projects?


A: Dashboards are designed to scale automatically. Adding new projects typically requires no changes - data simply flows through existing pipelines. If you change ERP systems or add new data sources, we can update connections for a small fee. We recommend quarterly reviews to ensure dashboards remain aligned with your needs.




Q: How do you ensure data security and access control?


A: We implement role-based security matching your organizational hierarchy. Directors see portfolio-level data, Project Managers see their projects, and stakeholders see only relevant sections. All connections use encrypted channels, and we follow ISO 27001 data security standards. Data remains in your environment - we never store client data on our systems.




Q: Can you migrate our existing Excel reports to dashboards?


A: Yes! This is one of our most common requests. Weâ€™ll analyze your existing Excel reports, identify key metrics, and recreate them as interactive dashboards with automated updates. Youâ€™ll save 10-20 hours per week currently spent on manual Excel updates while gaining much better insights.




Q: Do you provide ongoing support after implementation?


A: Yes. All implementations include 3 months of support. After that, we offer monthly retainer support packages (Â£500-2,000/month) for troubleshooting, enhancements, new dashboard development, and user training. Many clients also engage us quarterly for dashboard optimization and new feature development.

title: MEP Infrastructure Precision | Mechanical Electrical Plumbing Cost Estimation | BIM Takeoff
text:
Frequently Asked Questions



Q: What LOD (Level of Detail) do you need for accurate MEP costing?


A: LOD 300 minimum for Â±5% accuracy, LOD 350-400 for Â±3% accuracy. At LOD 300, we work with schematic routing and equipment schedules. LOD 350+ provides fabrication-level detail including all fittings, supports, and accessories. If your model is LOD 200, we can supplement with specifications and schematic drawings but accuracy reduces to Â±10%.




Q: How do you handle MEP coordination costs?


A: We include coordination in our estimates as both time (coordination meetings, clash resolution) and material (re-routing costs, additional fittings). For complex projects, coordination can add 3-5% to MEP costs. We also model design development risk - how much design is still to be finalized and what impact that has on pricing certainty.




Q: Can you cost MEP for projects with uncoordinated models?


A: Yes, but we add coordination contingency (5-10%) to account for clashes that will be discovered and resolved during construction. We can also run clash detection as part of our service and provide a clash resolution cost estimate, helping you understand the coordination risk in monetary terms.




Q: Do you include testing & commissioning in estimates?


A: Absolutely. T&C is often 3-8% of MEP installation costs and frequently overlooked. We include: pre-commissioning, functional testing, performance verification, integration testing, witness testing, seasonal commissioning, and 12-month defects monitoring. Each system has specific testing requirements we price accordingly.




Q: How do you price BMS/controls integration?


A: BMS costs include: hardware (controllers, sensors, actuators), software licenses, programming, graphics/dashboards, integration with specialist systems, training, and documentation. Typically 5-15% of MEP costs depending on building intelligence level. We price to BSRIA BG 50/2023 guidance for BMS specification levels.




Q: Can you benchmark our MEP costs against industry standards?


A: Yes, we benchmark against BCIS, Sponâ€™s, and our database of 2000+ projects. We provide Â£/sqm comparisons by building type, MEP proportion of total project cost, and system-by-system unit rates. This helps identify if your specification is over/under compared to market norms for similar buildings.




Q: What about MEP for renovations/existing buildings?


A: Renovation MEP is more complex due to: surveys of existing services, asbestos/contamination risks, working in occupied buildings, phasing/temporary services, tying into existing systems, and unknowns behind walls/ceilings. We typically add 15-25% contingency for existing building MEP work and recommend intrusive surveys to reduce uncertainty.




Q: How do you handle long lead equipment pricing?


A: For major equipment (chillers, generators, switchgear, UPS), we obtain budget quotations from manufacturers/suppliers and include delivery lead times in our assessment. We flag critical path items and recommend early procurement. We also model currency risk for imported equipment and inflation scenarios for long-lead items.

Structural Works

Concrete: formwork + reinforcement + pour + cure + finish

text:
Frequently Asked Questions



Q: What makes specialist trade estimating different from general estimating?


A: Specialist estimators have hands-on installation experience and understand the nuances that affect costs: fire-rated systems require specific installation sequences, facade work is weather-dependent, and structural connections have hidden complexity. We account for factors that generic estimators often miss, resulting in Â±3-5% accuracy versus Â±15-20% for general estimates.




Q: Do you work with specific material systems only?


A: No.Â We have experience with all major systems (Knauf, Gyproc, Siniat, Kingspan, Trespa, Hilti, etc.) and can estimate any manufacturerâ€™s products. Our expertise is in understanding the installation and performance characteristics, not brand loyalty. We often provide value engineering alternatives using different systems.




Q: Can you estimate supply-only packages?


A: Yes. We provide estimates for supply-only, install-only, or complete supply & install packages. Each requires different considerations for waste factors, logistics, and risk allocation. Supply-only typically includes 5-8% waste, while install packages factor 10-15% waste depending on complexity.




Q: How do you handle compliance requirements?


A: We budget for all testing, certification, and approval costs from the start. This includes fire ratings (AS 1530.4, BS 476, EN 13501), structural load testing, facade performance testing, and authority approvals. These costs, often 3-8% of package value, are frequently missed in generic estimates.




Q: What information do you need to provide an estimate?


A: Ideally: architectural drawings, specifications, material preferences, and any performance requirements (fire ratings, acoustic performance, wind loads). For complex projects, we may request structural drawings and coordination plans. We can work with preliminary information and refine as details become available.




Q: Do you provide value engineering alternatives?


A: Absolutely. Every specialist estimate includes value engineering recommendations: alternative material systems, installation methods, and performance-equivalent substitutions that can reduce costs without compromising quality. Typical savings opportunities range from 10-20% of package value.




Q: What project sizes do you handle?


A: We work on projects from small fit-outs (500 sqm) to large-scale developments (50,000+ sqm). Specialist trade complexity matters more than overall project sizeâ€”a high-rise facade is more complex than a large warehouse drylining package. Minimum fee applies for projects under â‚¬500,000.




Q: Do you support tendering processes?


A: Yes. We provide full tender support: quantity take-off, detailed cost breakdown, risk analysis, bid document preparation, and contractor evaluation. Our estimates give you confidence in your tender submissions. We can also attend tender interviews and negotiations.




Q: How quickly can you provide an estimate?


A: Standard timeline is 2-3 weeks for comprehensive specialist estimates. For urgent requirements, we offer fast-track service (5-7 working days) with a 30% surcharge. Initial budget estimates can be provided within 48 hours for feasibility studies.




Q: Do you work internationally?


A: Yes. While based in Poland, we have extensive experience with EU, UK, and Australian standards. Weâ€™ve completed projects across Europe, Asia-Pacific, and the Middle East. Our estimates include location factors for labor and material costs.

title: Traditional Quantity Takeoff | Manual Measurement Services | BIM Takeoff
text:
Frequently Asked Questions



Q: How accurate is traditional measurement compared to BIM takeoff?


A: Traditional measurement by experienced QS typically achieves Â±5-8% accuracy vs Â±3-5% for BIM takeoff. The difference is acceptable for most projects under Â£5M. For larger, more complex projects where precision is critical, BIM takeoff is recommended. However, traditional measurement remains more cost-effective for smaller jobs.




Q: What if our drawings are incomplete or at early design stage?


A: We work with concept and sketch designs regularly. Weâ€™ll make reasonable assumptions based on similar projects, document everything clearly, and provide ranges (e.g., Â±15-20%) rather than false precision. We can also highlight information needed to improve accuracy as design develops.




Q: Can you measure from site photos or survey data?


A: For renovation/refurbishment projects, yes! We can prepare BOQs from measured surveys, photographic surveys, or site visit notes. This is common for projects where as-built drawings donâ€™t exist. Accuracy depends on survey quality but typically achieves Â±10-12%, which is acceptable for renovation budgeting.




Q: Do you only measure buildings, or also civil works?


A: We measure both! Our team includes specialists in roads, drainage, earthworks, retaining structures, and utilities. We follow CESMM4 for civil engineering projects. Common projects include road construction, car parks, external works packages, and infrastructure projects.




Q: Whatâ€™s your minimum project size for traditional measurement?


A: We work on projects from Â£50K upwards. For very small projects (Â£50K-150K), we offer streamlined takeoffs with Â±10-15% accuracy at reduced rates. For projects Â£150K+, we provide full detailed measurement with Â±5-8% accuracy. No job is too small if you need professional measurement.




Q: Can you measure specific trades or packages only?


A: Absolutely! Many clients need measurement for one trade only - perhaps structural steelwork, facades, MEP, or groundworks. We provide specialist trade measurement services. Common requests include steelwork (weight calculations from sections), blockwork (net area calculations), and MEP (linear meter of pipework/cables).




Q: What format should we send drawings in?


A: PDF with embedded scale is ideal. Second choice is native CAD files (DWG, DGN). We can work with scanned PDFs or photographs of paper drawings if necessary, though this reduces accuracy. Send drawings via email (<50MB), file sharing (Dropbox, WeTransfer), or physical post for large format originals.




Q: Do you provide remeasurement after design changes?


A: Yes, and at discounted rates! If weâ€™ve already measured your project, remeasurement for design changes is typically 40-60% of original cost (depending on extent of changes). We maintain your original measurement files making updates efficient. Clients often engage us for multiple design iterations.




Q: What happens if your measurements are disputed later?


A: We provide complete audit trail - dimensional sheets showing every calculation. Disputes are rare because methodology is transparent. If quantities are questioned during tender or construction, we provide technical support at no charge for the first 2 hours. Professional indemnity insurance covers any errors (though claims are extremely rare given our QA processes).

title: Multi-Scenario Analysis | Value Engineering | BIM Takeoff
text:
Frequently Asked Questions



Q: When in the design process should we conduct multi-scenario analysis?


A: The earlier, the better! Ideally during RIBA Stage 2 (Concept Design) when design is still fluid and changes are low-cost. We can still provide value at Stage 3 (Spatial Coordination), though options become more constrained. Post-Stage 4, analysis is typically limited to value engineering specific elements.




Q: How many scenarios should we evaluate?


A: We typically recommend 5-7 scenarios for most projects. This provides sufficient breadth without overwhelming decision-makers. For complex projects with multiple variables, we may evaluate 10-12 scenarios. For simple decisions (e.g., single material choice), 3-4 scenarios may suffice.




Q: What if we donâ€™t have BIM models for each scenario?


A: We can work with conceptual sketches, single-line diagrams, or written descriptions for early-stage analysis. For higher-accuracy analysis, we recommend simple BIM models for each major scenario (LOD 200-300 is sufficient). We can also assist with rapid concept modeling if needed.




Q: How accurate are the cost comparisons?


A: At concept stage (RIBA 2), expect Â±15-20% accuracy - sufficient for scenario comparison. At spatial coordination (RIBA 3), we achieve Â±10-15%. The key is that all scenarios use consistent methodology, so relative comparisons remain valid even if absolute costs have margins.




Q: Can you help us achieve specific savings targets?


A: Yes! If you have a target (e.g., â€œreduce capital cost by 15%â€), weâ€™ll design scenarios specifically to achieve that goal while minimizing impact on performance. Weâ€™ll identify multiple pathways to the target, allowing you to choose the best tradeoff between cost, time, and quality.




Q: Do you consider sustainability in your analysis?


A: Absolutely. Every scenario includes embodied carbon calculation and operational energy assessment as standard. We can also include detailed BREEAM credit analysis, circular economy potential, material provenance, and whole-life carbon modeling if sustainability is a key priority.




Q: What happens after we select the optimal scenario?


A: We provide a detailed implementation roadmap including specification notes, procurement strategies, and risk mitigation measures for your chosen scenario. Many clients then engage us for detailed cost estimation, value engineering refinement, or ongoing cost control as the design develops.




Q: Can you analyze non-construction scenarios like procurement routes?


A: Yes! We frequently analyze procurement strategy options (traditional, design-build, management contracting, NEC vs JCT contracts), phasing strategies, temporary works solutions, and logistics alternatives. The same multi-criteria framework applies to any significant project decision.




Q: How do you handle subjective factors like aesthetics or stakeholder preferences?


A: Our decision matrix includes weighted criteria set by your team. You can assign higher weights to factors like design quality, brand alignment, or user experience. This ensures the analysis respects both objective metrics (cost, time) and subjective priorities (aesthetics, stakeholder preferences).
